etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French prisonier, from prison (see prison)

definitions: a person legally held in prison as a punishment for crimes they have committed or while awaiting trial

examples.text: a prisoner serving a life sentence

shortDefinitions: person legally committed to prison as punishment for crime

definitions: a person captured and kept confined by an enemy, opponent, or criminal

examples.text: the heroine was being held prisoner in a cave

shortDefinitions: person captured and kept confined by enemy or criminal

definitions: a person who is or feels confined or trapped by a situation or set of circumstances

examples.text: he's become a prisoner of the publicity he's generated

shortDefinitions: person who is or feels confined or trapped by situation
